SEQUENCES is for setting up the sequences and CONTROLLER for controlling them in realtime.
\n\nYou have any number of independent sequences (represented by colored tabs to the left) that plays in the order set in the
. Most thing can be randomized both manually and automatically (ex. randomize volume on a given step in a given track every measure).
LOAD/SAVE/CLEAR the project. CLEAR is destructive.
Shows the order of progression (if PROGRESSION is on). Clicking a cell will change to that sequence immediately or at the next measure depending on QUEUE. EDIT opens
\n\nRed triangle is the sequence currently playing. Grey is queued for change at the next measure.
\n\nThe green bar indicates what step the sequencer is on no matter what sequence is playing.
You access project options by clicking this button in the top row.
Choose either OpenSL or AAudio as the driver. Try what works best with your hardware.
The idea of CONTROLLER is to do things to sequences and ex. effects in a live setting. The big buttons lets you take off your socks and push them with your toes if you want to.
Purple shows the currently playing sequence. Red shows selected sequence (the one SEQ- and FUN-btns will operate on). Pink is queued for change at the next measure.
Select which sequence SEQ- and FUN-btns operate on.
Control sequence-related actions, ex. playing another sequence while the button is pressed etc. EDIT opens
. Holding or clicking SEQ will do whatever\'s set in options.
. Holding or clicking FUN will do whatever\'s set in options.
You access the sequence manager by clicking the edit button.
Change the order of progression by clicking a box and selecting a new. The slider enables/disables boxes.

If PROGRESSION is turned off the same sequence will always play unless changed manually. If it\'s turned on it will either progress in the order above or change to a random sequence, depending on RANDOMIZE. EDIT opens
\n\nIf QUEUE is on manual sequence changes will occur at the start of the next measure. If off it\'s instant.
\n\nRESET PROGRESSION resets progression when the sequence is stopped.

The cells in the track represents steps and works like a classic sequencer, ie clicking a step will change something depending on what\'s selected for editing. If a cell has more than one dot in it the step has two or more sub steps. Click and hold to edit subs. Open
Add a track. This button is always below the tracks so you might have to scroll down to see it.
Change the name and color of the sequence.
Set the tempo of this sequence. Sequences can have different tempos.
Make this sequence a copy of another sequence. A copied sequence is not in any way linked to the original meaning changes will not apply on the copy.
Access the randomize sequence manager by clicking the edit button.
Blueprint for the randomizations, either by using a preset or by creating from scratch.
Set the tempo of the randomized sequence.
Set the # of steps of the randomized sequence.

These represents tracks. 

In the first spinner you select a sound preset. In the second spinner with a number in it you select the number of sub steps. 

Every step has one or more sliders in it depending on # of sub steps. If it's full it will always be on. Half means 50% etc. 

Tick the FX-box for randomized effects on the track. Remove the track by clicking "-". Hold and drag to change order.
Access auto randomization by clicking this tab.

When AUTO RANDOMIZATION is selected the sequencer turns from showing its base value to showing its AUTORANDOMIZATION values. These are: 

 %: chance a randomization will occur. A full bar means a randomization will always occur. A half bar means a 50% chance of randomization.

 MIN: smallest possible randomized value.

 MAX: largest possible randomized value.

 RTRN: should the value return to what it was before the randomization after being played once.

 You select which one to edit in the top left corner of the sequencer.
If an auto randomization is active this purple dot will show on the step when in BASE mode.
Access the track menu by clicking the button with a name and arrows to the left of the track you want to edit.
Set the number of sub steps.

If ON is selected and 1/3 is clicked the selected sub/s in every 3rd step will be turned on, and all others off, etc. \n\nIf anything other than ON is selected the selected subs in every step will get the value selected.

Every track can have an unlimited amount of effects and all their parameters can be fully automated.
Randomize everything. This can not be undone.
List of the effects in the order they effect the signal with the top one being first. Hold and drag an effect to change order. Click an effect to edit it. Clicking \n\'-\' removes the effect.
Add a new random effect to the chain.
Every effect can have an unlimited number of automations on all their parameters, or several automations on the same parameter etc. \n\"+\" adds a new randomized automation.

Select what parameter to automate in the spinner and the value in the slider. The value will be applied in the selected steps, in unselected steps the value set in the effect will be used. \n\"-\" removes the automation.
